blurb: Marine scientists turn to unique methods to study and monitor whale populations.
description: Despite their incredible size and widespread adoration by the general public, surprisingly little is known about the behavior and distribution of many cetaceans (whales, dolphins, and porpoises). From acoustic tracking to electronic tagging technologies, new approaches are laying the groundwork for more effective study and conservation of cetaceans.
title: How hard can it be to find a whale?
